page.title: 16ROADS (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content:
Important routes, the {Harrow Way,}two Roman roads, the {Pilgrims Way,}the { {coaching roads} and the modern{dual {carriage-way} have all in their turn connected this area with the east and west. Pilgrims and travellers walked or rode horseback. Later travellers used coaches and carriages and last century the railway also connected Froyle with London and Winchester .
The modern dual carriage-way was built this century to keep motor traffic moving fast but the railway from Alton to Winchester closed a few years ago, with the possibility of a reduction to single track railway from Alton to Farnham, although many people still commute to London from the area.
